headline: Citizens Financial may slow hiring, CEO says
summary: Citizens Financial may temper hiring as uncertainty hangs over the economy, but it has no plans to cut staff, its chief executive told Reuters on Wednesday.  "We may slow down new hiring a bit until we see kind of where things are going, but we're not deciding that we need to  right-size the force," CEO Bruce Van Saun said.  The U.S.-based regional lender's profit fell in the first quarter as it brought in less income from interest payments.

The U.S.-based regional lender's profit fell in the first quarter as it brought in less income from interest payments.

headline: Citizens earnings, Travelers stock pops: Trending tickers
summary: Wealth Host Brad Smith, joined Madison Mills, takes a closer look at some of the trending tickers during the trading day. Citizens Financial Group (CFG) reported net interest income and revenue that were in line with estimates as the firm beat on earnings. Travelers (TRV) reported a profit beat, with core earnings per share (EPS) coming in at $1.91, compared to estimates of $0.75. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Citizens Financial's first-quarter profit falls as interest income declines
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies have sparked concerns over rising inflation and a potential recession, weakening consumer confidence and possibly dampening loan demand and spending.  Some of the biggest U.S. banks such as JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Citigroup were able to bolster their quarterly profits through strong equities trading amid volatility in the markets.  Excluding one-time costs, Citizens Financial earned 77 cents per share for the three months ended March 31, compared with 79 cents a year earlier.

headline: Citizens Financial Group: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) — Citizens Financial Group Inc. CFG) on Wednesday reported first-quarter net income of $373 million. The Providence, Rhode Island-based bank said it had earnings of 77 cents per share.

headline:
Citizens Financial Group, Inc. Reports First Quarter 2025 Net Income of $373 million and EPS of $0.77 
CET1 ratio of 10.6%; LDR 77.5%
summary: PROVIDENCE, R.I., April 16, 2025--Citizens Financial Group, Inc. (NYSE: CFG or "Citizens") today reported first quarter financial results. The earnings press release, investor presentation, and financial supplement are available at http://investor.citizensbank.com. In addition, these materials will be furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on a Form 8-K and will be available on the SEC website at www.sec.gov.
